trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref> objects.
Creates a new entry in the container.
You must call the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry.CommitChanges%2A> method on the new entry to make the creation permanent.
When you call this method, you can then set mandatory property values on the new entry.
The providers each have different requirements for properties that need to be set before a call to the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry.CommitChanges%2A> method is made.
If those requirements are not met, the provider might throw an exception.
Check with your provider to determine which properties must be set before committing changes.
The name of the new entry.
The name of the schema that is used for the new entry.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref> object that represents the new entry.
An error occurred during the call to the underlying interface.
Returns the member of this collection with the specified name.
If child objects of different types have the same name, the first matching child object is returned.
The Internet Information Services (IIS) provider does not support this method.
Use the overloaded <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries.Find%2A> method and specify an empty string ("") for the `schemaClassName` parameter.
If no matching result is found, a <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryServicesCOMException> with error code 0x2030 is thrown.
Contains the name of the child object for which to search.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref> that represents the child object that was found.
The Active Directory Domain Services object is not a container.
An error occurred during the call to the underlying interface.
Returns the member of this collection with the specified name and of the specified type.
If no matching result is found, a <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryServicesCOMException> with error code 0x2030 is thrown.
The name of the child directory object for which to search.
The class name of the child directory object for which to search.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref> object that represents the child object that was found.
The Active Directory Domain Services object is not a container.
An error occurred during the call to the underlying interface.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Deletes a member of this collection.
If the entry to be removed is a container, the container must be empty.
To delete a container and all its children, use the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry.DeleteTree%2A> method.
The name of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref> object to delete.
An error occurred during the call to the underlying interface.
Gets the schemas that specify which child objects are contained in the collection.

If the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries.SchemaFilter%2A> property is empty, child objects of all types are visible in the collection; otherwise, only those of the specified types are visible.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.SchemaNameCollection"></xref> that specifies which child objects are contained in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries"></xref> instance.
